info.name: Watson Campaign Automation XML API
info.description:
This collection contains samples of all WCA XML API calls available for consumption.  It uses the more secure OAuth 2.0 system for authentication.

Update the operation "Generate an Access Token" with your credentials to easily generate access tokens for API access to your organization.

Remember to replace the X in each URL with your Pod number, i.e. if your organization is on Pod 5, you should change your URLs to api5.ibmmarketingcloud.com before submitting.

item.name: Authentication (OAuth 2)

request.description: Using a combination of unique values for Client Id, Client Secret, and Refresh Token, this operation can be used to generate an Access Token to be used for additional authenticated API calls.

item.description: Save your own unique Client Id, Client Secret, and Refresh Token with this request for easy authentication in the future.

request.description: This interface returns details about a specific Automated Message Group.
This interface extracts a list of programs for an organization.

item.name: Add a contact to a program

request.description: This interface is used to add a contact to the beginning of a automated program.

item.name: Get a contact's relationship to programs

request.description: This interface extracst a list of programs for a specific contact or known web tracked visitor.
This interface adds one new contact to an existing database.
Confirm an Opt-in for a contact in a double opt-in database
This interface allows the removal of a contact from a database or contact list.
This interface updates a contact in an existing database.
This interface moves a contact in a database to an opted-out state.
This interface retrieves the information about a contact in a database.

item.name: Add a contact to a contact list

request.description:
This interface adds one new contact to an existing contact list.

Note: CONTACT_ID is a another identifier for the Recipient ID element found in other API inputs and responses.
This interface, along with SFTP, allows batch import of a mapping file and source file containing new, modified, or opted out contacts. Contacts can also be added to an existing contact list.
This interface exports contact data from a database, query, or contact list.

item.name: Bulk delete records from a list

request.description: This interface soft deletes all records from a target database, suppression, seed, test, or contact list based on the contacts that exist in a specific source database, contact list, or query.

item.name: Database Management
Get a list of databases, queries, contact lists, et al

request.description: This interface extracts lists for an organization.

item.name: Get meta data for a database, query, or relational table

request.description: This interface returns the description of a database, query, or relational table.
This interface allows adding a column to an existing Watson Campaign Automation database.
This interface updates a column value for all records in a restricted database or a classic query.
This interface creates a contact list for an existing WCA database.

item.name: Create a classic query of a database

request.description: This interface supports programmatically creating a classic query of an existing Watson Campaign Automation database.

item.name: Create a query of a database

body.raw:
<Envelope>
  <Body>
    <CreateQuery>
      <QUERY_NAME>Web Site Activity</QUERY_NAME>
      <PARENT_LIST_ID>348328</PARENT_LIST_ID>
      <VISIBILITY>1</VISIBILITY>
      <CRITERIA>
        <EXPRESSION criteria_type="behavior">
          <CONJUNCTION>AND</CONJUNCTION>
          <OPERATOR>has visited web site</OPERATOR>
          <WEB_SITE>test1.com</WEB_SITE>
          <TIMEFRAME>at any time</TIMEFRAME>
          <START_VALUE></START_VALUE>
          <END_VALUE></END_VALUE>
        </EXPRESSION>
        <EXPRESSION criteria_type="behavior">
          <CONJUNCTION>AND</CONJUNCTION>
          <OPERATOR>has visited web page</OPERATOR>
          <WEB_PAGE>www.ibm.com</WEB_PAGE>
          <TIMEFRAME>less than</TIMEFRAME>
          <VALUE>12</VALUE>
          <TIME_UNIT>days</TIME_UNIT>
        </EXPRESSION>
      </CRITERIA>
    </CreateQuery>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

request.description: This interface supports programmatically creating a query of an existing Watson Campaign Automation database.

item.name: Calculate the current contacts for a query

request.description: This interface executes a query to determine the number of matching contacts.

item.description: This section defines the automation interfaces for importing and/or updating databases from external files. We refer to these as User Actions.

item.name: Create a new dynamic content ruleset

body.raw:
<Envelope>
  <Body>
    <AddDCRuleset>
      <LIST_ID>12345</LIST_ID>
      <RULESET_NAME>My New Ruleset</RULESET_NAME>
      <CONTENT_AREAS>
        <CONTENT_AREA name="123" type="Body-HTML">
          <DEFAULT_CONTENT name="default"><![CDATA[this is the default content.]]></DEFAULT_CONTENT>
        </CONTENT_AREA>
      </CONTENT_AREAS>
      <RULES>
        <RULE>
          <RULE_NAME>Email is not blank</RULE_NAME>
          <PRIORITY>1</PRIORITY>
          <CRITERIA>
            <EXPRESSION criteria_type="profile">
              <COLUMN>Email</COLUMN>
              <OPERATOR>is not blank</OPERATOR>
            </EXPRESSION>
          </CRITERIA>
        </RULE>
      </RULES>
    </AddDCRuleset>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

request.description: This interface creates a ruleset including its content areas, rules, and content.

This interface imports a compressed file that contains an XML file that defines a new or classic dynamic content ruleset and any associated HTML or images. Imported files are loaded from the user's FTP upload directory.
This interface exports a specified ruleset and all associated content (including images), from the Asset Library as a compressed file.

item.name: Get a list of dynamic content rulesets for a mailing

request.description: This interface returns a list of available dynamic content rulesets for a specified mailing.
This interface returns the specified ruleset in XML format. It does not support returning content images.

body.raw:
<Envelope>
  <Body>
    <ReplaceDCRuleset>
      <RULESET_ID>8309</RULESET_ID>
      <CONTENT_AREAS>
        <CONTENT_AREA name="dc_mailing_subject" type="Subject">
          <DEFAULT_CONTENT name="Default.dc_mailing_subject">
            <![CDATA[All clothing on sale this week.]]>
          </DEFAULT_CONTENT>
        </CONTENT_AREA>
        <CONTENT_AREA name="dc_promo" type="Body-HTML">
          <DEFAULT_CONTENT name="Default.dc_promo">
            <![CDATA[10% Off Everything]]>
          </DEFAULT_CONTENT>
        </CONTENT_AREA>
      </CONTENT_AREAS>
      <RULES>
        <RULE>
          <RULE_NAME>MalePromotion</RULE_NAME>
          <PRIORITY>1</PRIORITY>
          <CRITERIA>
            <EXPRESSION>
              <AND_OR/>
              <LEFT_PARENS>(</LEFT_PARENS>
              <TYPE>TE</TYPE>
              <COLUMN_NAME>Gender</COLUMN_NAME>
              <OPERATORS>
                <![CDATA[=]]>
              </OPERATORS>
              <VALUES>
                <![CDATA[M]]>
              </VALUES>
              <RIGHT_PARENS>)</RIGHT_PARENS>
            </EXPRESSION>
            <EXPRESSION>
              <AND_OR>AND</AND_OR>
              <LEFT_PARENS>(</LEFT_PARENS>
              <TYPE>NE</TYPE>
              <COLUMN_NAME>Salary</COLUMN_NAME>
              <OPERATORS>
                <![CDATA[>]]>
              </OPERATORS>
              <VALUES>
                <![CDATA[90000]]>
              </VALUES>
              <RIGHT_PARENS>)</RIGHT_PARENS>
            </EXPRESSION>
          </CRITERIA>
          <CONTENTS>
            <CONTENT name="male_subject" content_area="dc_mailing_subject">
              <![CDATA[Men’s clothing on sale thisweek.]]>
            </CONTENT>
            <CONTENT name="male_promo" content_area="dc_promo">
              <![CDATA[10% Off All Men's Clothing]]>
            </CONTENT>
          </CONTENTS>
        </RULE>
        <RULE>
          <RULE_NAME>FemalePromotion</RULE_NAME>
          <PRIORITY>2</PRIORITY>
          <CRITERIA>
            <EXPRESSION>
              <AND_OR/>
              <PRIORITY>2</PRIORITY>
              <CRITERIA>
                <EXPRESSION>
                  <AND_OR/>
                  <LEFT_PARENS>(</LEFT_PARENS>
                  <TYPE>TE</TYPE>
                  <COLUMN_NAME>Gender</COLUMN_NAME>
                  <OPERATORS>
                    <![CDATA[=]]>
                  </OPERATORS>
                  <VALUES>
                    <![CDATA[F]]>
                  </VALUES>
                  <RIGHT_PARENS>)</RIGHT_PARENS>
                </EXPRESSION>
                <EXPRESSION>
                  <AND_OR>AND</AND_OR>
                  <LEFT_PARENS>(</LEFT_PARENS>
                  <TYPE>NE</TYPE>
                  <COLUMN_NAME>Salary</COLUMN_NAME>
                  <OPERATORS>
                    <![CDATA[>]]>
                  </OPERATORS>
                  <VALUES>
                    <![CDATA[90000]]>
                  </VALUES>
                  <RIGHT_PARENS>)</RIGHT_PARENS>
                </EXPRESSION>
              </CRITERIA>
            </EXPRESSION>
          </CRITERIA>
          <CONTENTS>
            <CONTENT name="female_subject" content_area="dc_mailing_subject">
              <![CDATA[Women's clothing on sale this week.]]>
            </CONTENT>
            <CONTENT name="female_promo" content_area="dc_promo">
              <![CDATA[10% Off All Women's Clothing]]>
            </CONTENT>
          </CONTENTS>
        </RULE>
      </RULES>
    </ReplaceDCRuleset>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

request.description: This interface replaces an existing ruleset with new parameters.
This interface performs a validation check against all dynamic content rulesets (including nested rulesets) associated with the specified mailing.
This interface deletes a specified ruleset from the Asset Library, and only if it is not associated with a mailing.
This interface creates a new relational table within Watson Campaign Automation.

item.name: Create a new, or bulk import records into, a relational table

request.description: This interface is used for creating or updating a relational table within Watson Campaign Automation.

item.name: Associate a relational table to a database

request.description: This interface associates a relational table to a database.  You can also use this API to remove an existing association by including the optional REMOVE element.  If specified, the Watson Campaign Automation API ignores any MAP_FIELD elements.

item.name: Insert or update records in a relational table

body.raw:
<Envelope>
  <Body>
    <InsertUpdateRelationalTable>
      <TABLE_ID>86767</TABLE_ID>
      <ROWS>
        <ROW>
          <COLUMN name="Record Id">
            <![CDATA[GHbjh73643hsdiy]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Purchase Date">
            <![CDATA[01/09/1975]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Product Id">
            <![CDATA[123454]]>
          </COLUMN>
        </ROW>
        <ROW>
          <COLUMN name="Record Id">
            <![CDATA[WStfh73643hsdgw]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Purchase Date">
            <![CDATA[02/11/1980]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Product Id">
            <![CDATA[45789]]>
          </COLUMN>
        </ROW>
        <ROW>
          <COLUMN name="Record Id">
            <![CDATA[Yuhbh73643hsfgh]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Purchase Date">
            <![CDATA[05/10/1980]]>
          </COLUMN>
          <COLUMN name="Product Id">
            <![CDATA[4766454]]>
          </COLUMN>
        </ROW>
      </ROWS>
    </InsertUpdateRelationalTable>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

request.description: This interface inserts new records or updates existing records within a relational table data.

item.name: Delete records from a relational table

request.description: This interface deletes specific records from a relational table.

item.name: Bulk export records from a relational table

request.description: This interface supports exporting relational table data from Watson Campaign Automation.

item.name: Bulk delete records from a relational table

request.description: This interface supports deleting Relational Table data from the Watson Campaign Automation.  You can purge all data (or specify a date range by using DELETE_BEFORE).
This interface supports deleting a relational table.

This interface allows exporting unique contact-level events and creates a compressed file that contains a single flat file with all metrics. You can request all (or a subset) of the event types during a certain time span.
This interface allows exporting unique web tracking events and creates a compressed file that contains a single flat file with all events.

item.name: Get a list of Report Ids for a mailing

request.description: This interface extracts the Report Ids for a particular mailing that were generated between specified dates.

item.name: Get a list of sent mailings for an org

request.description: This interface extracts a listing of sent mailings for an organization during a specified date range.

item.name: Get a list of sent mailings for a user

request.description: This interface extracts a listing of mailings that are sent for a user during a specified date range.

item.name: Get a list of sent mailings for a database

request.description: This interface extracts a listing of mailings that are sent for a particular database during a specified date range. It allows specification of an individual database or query in addition to a flag to include "children".

item.name: Get aggregate tracking metrics for an org

request.description: This interface extracts a listing of sent mailings and their metrics for an organization during a specified date range.

item.name: Get aggregate tracking metrics for a user

request.description: This interface extracts a listing of mailings that are sent by a user during a specified date range and provides metrics for those mailings.

item.name: Get aggregate tracking metrics for a mailing

request.description: This interface extracts metrics for a specified mailing.

item.name: Get mailing metrics for a contact

request.description: This interface returns a list of mailings for a specified database (or query) and individual contact as well as metrics associated with those sent mailings.

item.name: Get a list of scoring models

request.description: This interface returns a list of scoring models for an organization.  Standard permissions apply.

item.name: Get a contact's scoring model scores

request.description: This interface returns a contact’s scoring model's values. Note: CONTACT_ID is equivalent to RecipientId found in other API inputs and responses.

item.name: Get a list of mailing templates

request.description: This interface extracts a list of shared or private mailing templates for your organization. The templates that are returned can be limited by the date they were last modified.

item.name: Create or update a mailing template

body.raw:
0 Shared/WCA/Marketing Templates Subject of a Mailing 4 6 1924132
Mailing

This is an Example of a Mailing body. Visit IBM for more information

If you would like to no longer receive any emails from this campaign, click heret

]]> 2 http://www.ibm.com 14 0

request.description: This interface supports saving a new, or updating an existing, mailing template that can be used for sending to a database, contact list, or query.
This interface supports previewing a mailing before sending, and if a contact email address is provided will include fully personalized values for that contact.

item.name: Schedule a mailing to a contact source

body.raw:
<Envelope>
  <Body>
    <ScheduleMailing>
      <TEMPLATE_ID>1000</TEMPLATE_ID>
      <LIST_ID>100</LIST_ID>
      <MAILING_NAME>New Mailing Name</MAILING_NAME>
      <SEND_HTML/>
      <SEND_TEXT/>
      <SUBJECT>This is the new subject</SUBJECT>
      <FROM_NAME>Sender Name</FROM_NAME>
      <FROM_ADDRESS>sender@domain.com</FROM_ADDRESS>
      <REPLY_TO>sender@domain.com</REPLY_TO>
      <VISIBILITY>0</VISIBILITY>
      <PARENT_FOLDER_PATH>2017/October/18</PARENT_FOLDER_PATH>
      <CREATE_PARENT_FOLDER/>
      <SCHEDULED>10/18/2017 2:00:00 PM</SCHEDULED>
      <SEND_TIME_OPTIMIZATION>SEND_24HRS</SEND_TIME_OPTIMIZATION>
      <SUPPRESSION_LISTS>
        <SUPPRESSION_LIST_ID>37782</SUPPRESSION_LIST_ID>
        <SUPPRESSION_LIST_ID>37744</SUPPRESSION_LIST_ID>
      </SUPPRESSION_LISTS>
      <SUBSTITUTIONS>
        <SUBSTITUTION>
          <NAME>Sub_Value_1</NAME>
          <VALUE>The value to put in the mailing.</VALUE>
        </SUBSTITUTION>
        <SUBSTITUTION>
          <NAME>Sub_Value_2</NAME>
          <VALUE>Another value to put in the mailing.</VALUE>
        </SUBSTITUTION>
      </SUBSTITUTIONS>
      <APPEND_TAGS>
        <TAG>2017 Fall Campaign</TAG>
      </APPEND_TAGS>
      <VMTA>mail0000.yourbrand.com</VMTA>
    </ScheduleMailing>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

request.description: This interface can be used to schedule a template-based mailing for future delivery, or send a template-based mailing immediately to a specific database, query, or contact list.

item.name: Send an autoresponder to a contact

request.description: This interface supports the delivery of autoresponders to contacts based on a custom event.

This interface exports a mailing template from your organization.  The results are a .stl file (a compressed file that contains XML with an Watson Campaign Automation extension) which is written to the FTP account associated with the current session. You can (optionally) copy the resulting file to Stored Files.

item.name: Forward a mailing to a friend

request.description: This interface supports sending a copy of a mailing, along with an extra message, to the specified contacts.
This interface returns details about a mailing that was sent to a specific contact.  It requires a contact-specific SureFrom code.

item.name: Get the status of a data job

request.description: This interface allows monitoring the status of a job after the data job is initiated.

item.name: Get folder path for a folder or object

request.description: This interface returns the folder path for a specified Folder ID or a specified Object ID (ex: database, query, contact list, or mailing).

item.name: Get the contents of a user's stored files directory

request.description: This interface supports retrieving a listing of directory within a user's stored files.
